3.104. 
Content of the marriage contract 
1. The spouses have the right to stipulate in the marriage contract that: 
1) the property acquired both before and during the marriage is the separate property of each spouse; 
2) the property acquired by each spouse before the marriage and which is their separate property becomes their community property after the registration of the marriage; 
3) the property acquired during the marriage is community property.
2. The spouses may stipulate in the marriage contract that one of the types of property regime provided for in paragraph 1 of this Article shall apply to the whole of the property, or to a certain part of it, or to specific objects only. 
3. The spouses may, in the marriage contract, determine the legal regime of both existing and future property. 
4. The spouses may determine in the marriage contract the rights and obligations relating to the management of the property, the maintenance of the property, the participation in family needs and expenses, the manner and procedure for the division of the property in the event of the dissolution of the marriage, and any other matters relating to the property relations between the spouses. 
5. The rights and obligations of the spouses under the marriage contract may be limited by a time limit, or the creation or termination of obligations and rights may be linked to the fulfilment or non-fulfilment of a condition contained in the contract.
